related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* MoyinShabi is experiencing issues connecting Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* The issue started after a recent Pieces update.
* MoyinShabi did not receive any notification on a health check.

**Problems identified:**

* Issue with MoyinShabi's desktop app's database.
* A bug in the Pieces for Developers app that potentially could have been impacting the issue.
* Error initializing DB in the Pieces for Developers app, indicating a missing dependency in the GetIt flutter package.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mack-at-pieces requested log files and the "com.pieces.pfd" folder for analysis.
* Mack-at-pieces suggested replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder with a repaired version.
* Mack-at-pieces fixed a bug that could have been impacting the issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* MoyinShabi is still encountering the same issue after replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* MoyinShabi identified an error in the log file related to the GetIt flutter package.
* The root cause of the issue is still under investigation.

**Additional notes:**

* MoyinShabi is experiencing poor network connection, which may be impacting the troubleshooting process.
* Mack-at-pieces is still working on resolving the issue.

common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems installing and using Ollama within the Pieces OS environment across different operating systems. related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User is unable to download Ollama LLM in Pieces-OS due to missing `curl` dependency.
* `curl` is not available in the sandboxed environment of the Pieces-OS snap.
* The issue persists in the latest version of Pieces-OS.

**Problems Identified:**

* Incorrect confinement settings in the snap definition file.
* Inability to use Ollama from within the Pieces-OS sandbox.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Add `curl` to the list of dependency packages in the snap definition file.
* Implement a patch that allows Ollama to be used from the sandbox.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The fix is currently under development and is expected to be released in the near future.
* Users are unable to download or use Ollama in the meantime.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue also impacts LLM inference, not just downloading.
* Users are concerned about privacy and security implications of using cloud-based LLMs.

**Timeline:**

* The issue was reported on December 18, 2024.
* As of March 3, 2025, the fix is still under development.

* User (@rafael-a-g-n) reported an issue with LTM (likely related to high CPU usage).
* The issue was automatically triaged by the Pieces support bot.
* The bot provided related issues and helpful resources.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM was experiencing high CPU usage on Linux Mint 22.1.
* LTM cannot see code inside a sandbox in the browser.
* Non-dismissable overlay messages were appearing.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team is working on a major release to LTM (LTM2) with fixes and enhancements.
* Users are advised to wait for the release of 11.2.0 PiecesOS.
* If issues persist, users can schedule a meeting with @mark-at-pieces on their calendar.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently awaiting the release of LTM2.
* Users can try the solutions provided or schedule a meeting if the issue persists.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place between February 27, 2025 and March 3, 2025.
* The specific details of @rafael-a-g-n's original issue were not included in the provided conversation.

- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
